The petitioner has alleged that, contrary to the Supreme Court's directions which state that collecting Aadhaar data by government organizations is not mandatory and violates Article 21 of the Indian Constitution, the authorities at respective Sub Registrars are demanding Aadhaar card numbers from parties seeking registrations through GPA and sale deed.

This practice has not only caused distress among citizens but also raised concerns about constitutional rights and privacy infringements. The petitioner has urgently appealed to the Hon’ble Governor of Andhra Pradesh for intervention. The petitioner requests necessary actions to provide relief to citizens and ensure compliance with legal directives, thereby aiding in the legitimate collection of registration charges for the exchequer.
